note.p: Birth: 48 Skene Terrace, Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, Scotland (12 June 1843)

Career: Entered his father's business and ran it for some time; started an observatory, King's College, Aberdeen; in charge of the private observatory of James 26th Earl of Crawford (FRS 1878), Dunecht, near Aberdeen; observed the Transit of Venus at Mauritius (1874); measured the distance of Mars from the Earth from Ascension Island; Her Majesty's Astronomer, Cape of Good Hope; President, British Association (1907); died of pneumonia
Mrs David Gill 'Six months in Ascension; an unscientific account of a scientific expedition' with introduction by David Gill (1878)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1914-1915 vol 91 pp xxvi-xlii, plate, signed by F W D
